page.title: 17LOCAL HISTORY MIDDLETON
page.content: {MIDDLETON}is one of the older areas within the Cowling Parish.It is just a street of cottages which were built by quarry workers for themselves.The cottages are all a different design and look different inside too.When they were built there was no mains water and many of the houses had a well in the cellar.Some of the cottages became shops,and at one time there was a butcher,Post Office, greengrocer,Co-op and hairdresser. The allotments which had been allowed became gardens after the Second World War.One of Cowling's most famous sons was{Philip Snowden, }who became Chancellor of the Exchequer in the first Labour Government of 1923. He used to live in a small cottage in Middleton,which now has a plaque to remember him.
